div.ab:
أعرف اعترف عندي البائع بقبض من المشتري بالسّلم
بسم اللّه الرّحمن الرّحيم وكتب سليمن بن إدريس في تأريخه الحمد للّه كالحق
هذا ما اشترى المكنّا بأبي السّري بن هليه بن رفرفيل النّصراني من ثيدرس بن كيل بن هلستوس الأجير وهما يومئذ من أهل الضّيعة المعروفة ببلجسوق ترس من بعض قرى كورة الفيّوم من صعيد مصر اشترى منه سفقة
واحدا وعقدا واحدا جميع ما ذكر أنّه له وملكه بالضّيعة المعروفه المقدّم پالدكرها ذكرها من العرصة القبليّة ويحــيط بها ويشتــمل عليها حدود أربع الحد الأوّل منها وهو القبلي ينتهي إلى طريق المارّة منه يشرع باب هذه العرصة والمدخل
إليها والمخرج منها والحد الثّاني البحري ينتهي إلي عراص أبنييلة بن إسحق والحد الثّالث الشّرقي إلى القرمــاص ابن المكنّا بأبي السّري بن هليه وثيدرس بن كيل هذا والحد الرّابع الغربي ينتهي إلي منزل يحنّس بن بردسنه
فاشترى المكنّا بأبي السّري بن هلــيه بن رفرفيل جميع هذه العرصة بحدّها وحدودها وســفلها وعلوّها وأرضها وسمايها وعراصها وأفنيها وكلّما يعرف لها وينسب إليها شرا ثابت صحيحا لا شرط فيه ولا وعد
ولا إتوى ولا خيار ولا وديعة ولا رهينة ولا مقاصصة مقايضة بدين ولا شرط يفسد شرا على شرط بــيع الإسلام وأنفذ أحكامهم من أقصا شروطهم وحازها وملكها وصارت مالا من ماله وملك من أملاكه إن شا باع
وإن شا باوهب وإن شا صدّق بثمن مبلغه من العين ربع دينار النّصف من ذلك ثمن دينار قبض ثيدرس بن كيل بن هلستوس الأجير جميع هذا الثّمن المذكور على تمامه وكماله وأبرأه من جميع ذلك ومن وزنه ونقده ومن اليمين
عليه أو على شيا منه براه قبض واستيفا واعترفا وافترقا جميعا منهما بالأمر بالابدان أن ø يحسن عن بتراضٍ تراضٍ منهما وبري على كل حي من حي ومتى أدرك المكنّا بأبي السّري بن هليه بن رفرفيل في شرايه أو في شيا منه درك علقة أو خصومة من ساير
النّاس كانهكان قريب أم بعيد شاهد أم غائب طارئ بدين أو مستحق بميراث فپڤإدهڤانقاذه فإنفاذه فنفاذه وفكاكه وخلاصه علي ثيدرس بن كيل بن هلستوس الأجير كائن ما كان وبالغ ما بلغ بعد أن قرئ عليهما جميعا جميع ما فيه
حرفا حرفا من أوّله إلى آخره وعرفاه وأقرّا بفهمه ومعرفته وذلك في صحّة عقولهما وأبدانهما وجواز أمورهما طائعان طالبان غير مكرهان ولا مجبران ولا مضطهدان في رجب من سنة ثمان وأربعين وأربعماية
والحجرة الفوقانيّة مجازها في شرا المكنّا پا بأبي السّري بن هليه لهذا إلى دار قنجــوش وبــذلك رفعت الشّهادة في التّأريخ صح شهد بو سهل بن خلف بن إبرهيم المودن على إقرار
المقرّان بها نسب إليهما فيه وكتب بيده في تأريخه الحمد للّه كما هو أهله
وعلى المجاز وثبتت الشّهادة
شهد نهار بهار بن سليمن بن إدريس
بجميع ما سمّي ووصف في هذا الكتاب وكتب بيده صح
شهد ــڤاس ــفاس ــعاس قاسم بن محمّد بن جعفر على إقرار المقر
بجميع ما فيه وكتب بخطّه في تأريخه والحمد للّه كما هو أهله

bi smi ăl lāhi ăr raḥmāni ăr raḥīmi wa kataba sulaymānu bnu ʾidrīsa fī taʾrīḫi hi ăl ḥamdu li ăl lāhi ka ăl ḥaqqi

The seller has acknowledged before me that he has taken over from the buyer the price paid beforehand,
In the name of God, the Compassionate, the Merciful. | and Sulaimân b. Idrîs has written (it) on this date. Praise be to God as is due.
This is what the surnamed Abû Sarî b. Helia b. Rafrafîl, the Christian, has bought from Theodoros b. Chael b. Halistos, the journeyman, who both are numbered at this time among the people of the domain known as Bulgusûq Teres (?), belonging to the villages of the district of al-Fayyûm in Upper-Egypt: he has bought from him in one striking
(of hands) and one contract, all the southern open area that he had mentioned as owned by him and being his property in the aforesaid domain, enclosed and surrounded by four boundaries: the first boundary, viz. the southern, ends at the main thoroughfare with which the door of this open area communicates so as to afford entrance to
and exit from it; the second, the northern boundary, extends to the open areas belonging to Abnîle b. Isḥâq; the third, the eastern boundary, to the cave[rn of ..............................], son of the surnamed Abû Sarî b. Helia and this Theodoros b. Chael, the fourth, the western boundary extends to the dwelling house of Yoḥannes b. Bardesane.
The surnamed Abû Sarî b. [Hel]ia b. Rafrafîl, has, therefore, bought the whole of this open area to its limit and its boundaries and (including) what is be[low and above the surface], its land and its sky, and its open areas and its fore-courts, and all that is known as appertaining and relating to it, in form of a right, valid purchase, in which is no condition and no promise
and nothing that can bring about a loss and no option (of return) and no deposit and no pledge and no mutual balancing of debts and no stipulation that renders a purchase ineffective [according to Is]lamic law of sale. And he has carried out their (the Muslims) prescriptions to their extremest conditions and he has occupied it and has taken possession of it, and it has become his own property and possession, (so that) if he will, he may sell it, ... their (the Moslim) prescriptions ...
and if he will, he may give it away, and if he will, he may give it as an alms, (and that) for a price, which in gold-coins amounts to a quarter of a dînâr, the half thereof being an eighth of a dînâr. Theodoros b. Chael b. Halistos, the journeyman, has received the whole of the said price fully and entirely and he has released him from all of it and from its weight and ready money and from the oath and if he wishes, he may give it away, and if he wishes, he may give it as an alms, (and that) for a price ...
... by their mutual consent. And quittance has been given by one man amongst the quick (alive) to another amongst the quick; and should any (evil) consequence (vindicatio) ... with regard to it or any portion thereof, by a receipt (acknowledging that he has) received and taken (it) over fully; and they have both jointly acknowledged the bargain to be good by their (mutual) consent. And quittance has been given by one man in the quick to another in the quick, and should any evil consequence (vindicatio) with regard to his purchase or any portion thereof befall the surnamed Abuʾs Sarî b. Helia b.Rafrafîl, on the basis of any contention or litigation on the part of other
persons, be they near or far, present or absent, one who suddenly appears with a debt or one who makes a claim on the basis of an inheritance, then its carrying out, redemption and indemnification are incumbent upon Theodoros b. Chael b. Halistos, the journeyman, whatever it might be or amount to. The whole content of this has been read to both of them jointly persons, be they near or far, present or absent, one who suddenly appears with a debt or one who makes a claim on the basis of an inheritance, then its execution, redemption and indemnification are incumbent upon Theodoros b. Chael b. Halistos, the journeyman, whatever it might be or amount to. The whole content of this has been read to both of them jointly persons, be they near or far, present or absent, one who suddenly appears with a debt or one who makes a claim on the basis of an inheritance, then its recuperation, redemption and indemnification are incumbent upon Theodoros b. Chael b. Halistos, the journeyman, whatever it might be or amount to. The whole content of this has been read to both of them jointly
... capacity of transacting ... in Ragab of the year four hundred and forty eight word by word from beginning to end; and they are cognizant of it and have acknowledged that they have understood it and comprehend it, and this in soundness of mind and body and capacity for transacting their business, voluntarily, demanding (it), without compulsion and not against their will and not under constraint, in Raǧab of the year four hundred and forty eight;
and the passage in the upper tract (of the property concerned) in the purchase of the surnamed Abuʾs-Sarî b. Helia, leading to the house of Qanǧ[ūš], is free to him and (the following witnesses) have testified to it on the (same) date: Valid. Bû Sahl b. Ḫalaf b. Ibrahîm, the muezzin, is witness to the acknowledgment ... leading to the house of Qang[ūsh] ... Bû Sahl b. Khalaf b. Ibrahîm ...
on the part of both the acknowledgers in respect to that herein which concerns them, and he has written (it) with his (own) hand on this date - Praise be to God as He is worthy thereof -
and with regard to the (said) passage the testimony has been verified.
Nahâr b. Sulaimân b. Idrîs is witness
to all that is named and described in this act and he has written (it) with his (own) hand. Valid.
[.........]âs b. Muḥammad b. Ǧaʿfar [is witness] to the acknowledgment by the acknowledgers [.........]âs b. Muḥammad b. Gaʿfar ...
[to all that] (is contained) herein and he has written (it) in his (own) handwriting on this date. And praise be to God, as He is worthy thereof. Valid.
